com.tokelon.toktales.core.render.order

Interface IRenderOrder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    RenderOrder

    public interface IRenderOrder
    Represents a list of layers which can have stacks containing render calls.

    The layers are indexed starting from zero but indexes can remain empty, meaning they contain no layer or stack. This allows for us to insert layers at specific indexes without having to fill the ones in between. Additionally it will not insert a layer at an index if it already contains the same layer (name). All this enables this structure to function independently of the order the layers are registered.

    There are two special layers, bottom and top. You can access them via their names LAYER_BOTTOM and LAYER_TOP.

    Bottom layer is always at index 0 and cannot be moved or replaced.
    Top layer is always at index count - 1 and cannot be replaced.
    Other than that they act like any other layer, except they will never be empty.

    The underlying implementation must ensure thread safety internally for calls and externally for iterations when synchronized on this object.

      static interface  IRenderOrder.IOrderNavigator

    • Method Detail

      • insertLayerAt

        void insertLayerAt(int index,
                   String layerName)
        Same as insertTaggedLayerAt(int, String, String) using the a default (empty) tag.
        Parameters:
        index -
        layerName -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If index <= 0 or layerName is null.

      • insertTaggedLayerAt

        void insertTaggedLayerAt(int index,
                         String layerName,
                         String tag)
        Checks if there already is a layer on the given index.
        If not, creates the layer with the given name. If yes, checks if the layer name matches the given name.
        If the names match, the existing layer will be reused but it will be assigned to the given tag (!). If not, inserts a new layer with the given name at the given index, and moves the old layer to index+1.

        If the layer on the index is empty, a new layer will be set on the given index.

        Note: You cannot insert at index 0 because of the bottom layer. (See IRenderOrder for more info on bottom and top).
        Parameters:
        index -
        layerName -
        tag -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If index <= 0 or layerName or tag is null.

      • removeTaggedLayer

        boolean removeTaggedLayer(String layerName,
                          String tag)
        Removes the layer with the given name and tag. If there is no such layer, it will have no effect. If there are multiple layers with the given name and tag, it will remove the first in order.
        Parameters:
        layerName -
        tag -
        Returns:
        True if a layer was removed, false if not.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If layerName or tag is null.

      • removeAllTaggedLayers

        boolean removeAllTaggedLayers(String tag)
        Removes all layers with the given tag. If there are no such layer, it will have no effect.
        Parameters:
        tag -
        Returns:
        True if any layers were removed, false if not.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If tag is null.

      • removeLayer

        boolean removeLayer(String layerName)
        Removes the layer with the given name. If there is no such layer, it will have no effect. If there are multiple layers with the given name, it will remove the first in order.
        Parameters:
        layerName -
        Returns:
        True if a layer was removed, false if not.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If layerName is null.

      • registerCall

        boolean registerCall(String layerName,
                     double position,
                     IRenderCallback callback)
        Registers a call for the given layer and position.

        If a layer with the given name already exists, the call is added immediately. If multiple layers with the given name exist, the call is added to the first in order.
        Parameters:
        layerName -
        position -
        callback -
        Returns:
        True if the call was immediately added, false if not.

      • removeRegisteredCall

        boolean removeRegisteredCall(String layerName,
                             double position)
        Removes the registered call for the given layer name and position.

        If multiple calls for the given position exist, the first in order is removed.
        Parameters:
        layerName -
        position -
        Returns:
        True if there was a call removed from the given position, false if not.

      • hasLayer

        boolean hasLayer(String layerName)
        Parameters:
        layerName -
        Returns:
        True if there is a layer for the given name, false if not.

      • isIndexEmpty

        boolean isIndexEmpty(int index)
        Use with caution: Calling this method twice is not guaranteed to return the same result, as layers can shift.
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        True if the given index is empty, false if not.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If index < 0 or index >= index count.

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getStackForIndex

        IRenderLayerStack getStackForIndex(int index)
        Use with caution: Calling this method twice is not guaranteed to return the same result, as layers can shift.
        Known layers should always be accessed by their names via getStackForLayer(String).
        Parameters:
        index -
        Returns:
        The layer stack for the given index, or null if the index is empty.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If index < 0 or index >= index count.

      • getLayerStacks

        Collection<IRenderLayerStack> getLayerStacks()
        The returned collection is ordered by indexes and includes null values for empty indexes.

        Note that when iterating over the returned collection you must synchronize on this object to ensure thread safety.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable collection representing the layer stacks.

      • getLayers

        Collection<String> getLayers()
        The returned collection is ordered by indexes and includes null values for empty indexes.

        Note that when iterating over the returned collection you must synchronize on this object to ensure thread safety.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable collection representing the layer names.

      • getRegisteredCalls

        Map<String,IRenderLayerStack> getRegisteredCalls()
        Note that when iterating over the returned map you must synchronize on this object to ensure thread safety.
        Returns:
        An unmodifiable map containing all registered mappings from layer name to layer stack.

      • getTaggedLayers

        Map<String,? extends Collection<IRenderLayerStack>> getTaggedLayers()

      • getFullLayerCount

        int getFullLayerCount()
        Returns:
        The number of layers currently. This includes empty layers as well as bottom and top layers.

      • getAddedLayerCount

        int getAddedLayerCount()
        Returns:
        The number of layers that were added. This includes empty layers. Does not include bottom and top.

      • getTopIndex

        int getTopIndex()
        Returns:
        The index of the top layer, which is also the highest index.
